item.title: Black Ops 6 & Warzone: How To Unlock The C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags
item.description:
Black Ops 6 and Warzone Season 3 dedicates much of its content to reviving the best aspects of recent titles, bringing back familiar battlegrounds like Verdansk and Firing Range, along with iconic weapons like the Grau 5.56. Season 3’s in-season content continues to pay tribute to older games, especially with the arrival of a unique event.

Weapons like the Nail Gun aren’t the only returning features in Season 3’s in-season content, as another blast from the past has resurfaced in the form of the 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags for the C9. This attachment was last seen in Modern Warfare 2019 for the MP5 and offers some neat benefits for those who choose to equip it with the C9 Submachine Gun. Here’s how to get the C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags in Black Ops 6 and Warzone .

How To Unlock The C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags In Black Ops 6 & Warzone

The C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags is one of the many free rewards tied to the Black Ops Tribute Event , which is live for both games for a limited time. To unlock it, players will need to earn a total of 248,000 XP in Black Ops 6 and Warzone during the event’s runtime. Upon doing so, it will become available as a magazine attachment that can be equipped on the C9 Submachine Gun.

Following the end of the Black Ops Tribute Event on May 1 at 10 AM PT, the C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags will be made available as an Armory Unlock for those who did not obtain it during the event.

How Good Are The C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags?

The C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags are a solid attachment for the C9 in Black Ops 6 and Warzone , effectively enhancing the weapon’s ability to kill faster and perform better at range. When equipped, the C9 gains an increase in base damage across the board, and a boost to bullet velocity. Although the weapon’s overall fire rate is slightly reduced, the C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags actually improves its base TTK across virtually all ranges.

However, there are a few trade-offs to consider. Recoil gun kick and vertical recoil control both take a slight hit, making the weapon's accuracy a bit tougher to manage at longer distances without compensating attachments. Additionally, players are locked into a 30-round magazine capacity , which, while manageable in Multiplayer, can feel limiting in Warzone —especially when facing multiple enemies in quick succession.

For those looking for an overview of the C9's stats with the C9 10mm Auto 30-Round Mags equipped, check out our breakdown here:

item.title: Fatal Fury City of the Wolves Collector's Box Unboxing - Game Rant Mailbag
item.description: Game Rant Editor-In-Chief Anthony Taormina unboxes the Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Collector’s Box, showcasing all its limited edition accessories, messages from SNK, and more! Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves releases on April 24 on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and Windows.

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy: Worst Talents You Should Avoid
item.description:
Summary

  • Depulso Mastery is too situational and outclassed by other spells, making it a poor choice for a talent point.
  • Sense of Secrecy 1 is not necessary for stealth builds and becomes less valuable as players progress.
  • Curse Sapper and Edurus Potion Potency are better off avoided due to their limited usefulness in later stages of the game.

In the magical world of Harry Potter, not all spells are created equal, and the same goes for talents in Hogwarts Legacy. The game offers 48 unique talents to help players shape their witch or wizard, but with only 36 talent points available, every choice matters.

Whether they’re underpowered, overly situational, or made redundant by other spells, certain talents are better left untouched. While some might seem useful at first glance, they often fail to live up to expectations. With that in mind, here’s a breakdown of the worst talents in Hogwarts Legacy that most players are better off avoiding.

6 Depulso Mastery

Improves The Depulso Spell

  • Talent Tree: Spells
  • Level Required: 5

Depulso is certainly a fun spell, and the visuals of knocking back multiple enemies at once really give the player a sense of power. However, it only truly shines in tight spaces with multiple enemies, or when near sheer drops and water, where players can push opponents to their deaths.

The Depulso spell is too situational for its mastery to be worth a talent point, especially when other similar spells deal much more damage. If the spell dealt a bit more damage, it would be more useful, but as it stands, it's often outclassed by other options and only comes in handy in specific environments.

5 Sense of Secrecy 1

Makes It Easier To Sneak Past Enemies

  • Talent Tree: Stealth
  • Level Required: 5

Unless players are going deep into a stealth build, Sense of Secrecy 1 is a talent that should probably be avoided. Sense of Secrecy 1 reduces the enemy's ability to detect the player. While this may seem useful early on, as players progress, they get better at stealth and can easily bypass enemies without being detected.

With that said, most of the other Stealth talents, aside from Petrificus Totalus Mastery, should probably be avoided as well. Human Demiguise can be somewhat useful for well-rounded players, but it also doesn’t hold up long-term. Unless the stealth mechanics in the game are updated or stealth becomes more crucial, the Stealth talents, especially Sense of Secrecy 1, aren't the best choices for most players.

4 Curse Sapper

Heals The Player When Defeating Cursed Enemies

  • Talent Tree: Dark Arts
  • Level Required: 22

Curse Sapper restores a portion of the player's health when they defeat a cursed opponent. While this may seem like a useful talent, by the time players unlock it at level 22, it’s not very useful. By this point in the game, players should have a decent amount of gear and spells unlocked, which reduces the need for this talent.

Had Curse Sapper been available at level 5, it could have been one of the most useful talents in the game, as the player is much weaker at the start. However, in the later levels, most enemies become more of a nuisance than a threat. A talent that restores health only when defeating cursed enemies becomes less useful than many other talents at the player's disposal.

3 Edurus Potion Potency

Only Useful At Lower Levels

  • Talent Tree: Room Of Requirement
  • Level Required: 5

The Edurus Potion is one of the more unique potions in Hogwarts Legacy . It makes the player invulnerable while deflecting enemy projectiles. While this may seem like a great potion, considering that dodging and blocking are key parts of the gameplay, most players won't actually need to use the potion at all.

Seasoned players will have no problem blocking or dodging enemy attacks while dishing out their own, making the Edurus Potion somewhat pointless. That said, for newer or weaker players, the potion might have some use. However, it can make the game a little too easy at times, and the talent point could be better spent elsewhere.

2 Slowing Curse

Improves The Spell Arresto Momentum

  • Talent Tree: Dark Arts
  • Level Required: 16

For players using the Dark Arts talent tree, Slowing Curse is a talent they'll probably want to skip. It’s just not that useful. While having an extra spell to curse opponents can be helpful and definitely works with certain builds or combos, but on its own, Slowing Curse isn't worth it.

Other spells like Glacius outclass Arresto Momentum, so spending a precious talent point to improve Arresto Momentum is not the best idea. Of course, it will work in certain builds, especially those centered around the Dark Arts, but for more well-rounded players, a talent point would be better spent elsewhere.

1 Revelio Mastery

Increase The Range Of Revelio

  • Talent Tree: Core
  • Level Required: 16

The Revelio Mastery talent increases the range of the spell Revelio. While it may be useful for players who aren't as eagle-eyed, for the average player, it's a waste of a talent point. The standard Revelio reveals enough for most players without the need for the extra range.

Players who are not using the Dark Arts tree may have an extra 10 talent points to allocate. Therefore, Revelio Mastery might not be a terrible choice for these players, especially if they use Revelio often. However, it’s still better to avoid it, as that talent point could be better spent elsewhere.

item.title: Blue Prince: Best Rooms To Pick
item.description:
Summary

  • Pick rooms wisely to benefit from coins, mail, and hints.
  • Rooms like the Nursery and Foyer can offer essential bonuses for progress.
  • Make strategic choices with rooms like Workshop and Armory for crafting and unique items.

The roguelike puzzle adventure, Blue Prince , has been a surprise hit with players across both PC and consoles. The game's unique concept of drafting the layout of the mansion and its rooms through player-driven choices on each run is well realized. The varied choices and risk/reward nature of exploration lead to a compelling gameplay loop that has struck a chord with many players.

Picking rooms to draft isn't easy, though. There are a lot of options, many of which players won't see until they've worked out how to get further into the mansion and make more progress each run. Without some experience from playing with the rooms in a trial-and-error manner, players won't fully understand how these rooms all interact.

That's why it can be useful to go in armed with a little foreknowledge of what some of the more desirable rooms can do. This will make life a little easier as players get to grips with the puzzle mechanics and navigate the mansion. There are a lot of rooms, some are essential to progress, and some offer unique benefits. Focusing on beneficial effects rather than game progression, these are some of the best rooms to pick in Blue Prince .

1 Vault

Vast Wealth

  • Room Effects: Gives 40 coins
  • Cost: 3 gems

The Vault is a dead-end room, but it's a valuable one, as it grants 40 coins on entry. The drafting cost is three gems, making it an expensive room to draft, but if players need gold, there's no better room to collect a swift payout.

2 Mail Room

Pen Pals

  • Room Effects: Receives mail the day after drafting
  • Cost: No cost

The Mail Room can be useful for all sorts of reasons. It's a tomorrow room, which means players receive the benefit the day after they draft it. In this case, that's receiving mail. The mail can include items, tools, and even puzzle solutions, so it's worth drafting. The Mail Room can also be upgraded so that the mail goes directly to the entrance hall, which saves steps and a drafting slot eventually.

3 Rumpus Room

Fortune Teller

  • Room Effects: Receive 8 gold, can get clues from Great Alzara, the fortune-teller
  • Cost: 1 gem

The Rumpus Room can be a useful room for players looking for hints into the deeper mysteries of the mansion. As well as giving a few coins on entry, players can interact with Great Alzara, the fortune-teller here, to receive hints about hidden locations and story elements. It's not the most valuable room to draft in a run, but it can help uncover some of the trickier secrets in Blue Prince .

4 Nursery

Extra Steps

  • Room Effects: +5 steps for every bedroom drafted
  • Cost: 1 gem

Running out of steps is a run-ender in Blue Prince , and that means rooms that replenish or give extra steps are highly valuable. The Nursery's bonus starts at +5 steps, which isn't huge, but players also get +5 steps for every bedroom they draft.

Once players have access to the Bunk Room, this counts as two bedrooms when drafted, so that's +10 steps for each one of those rooms. The bonus can stack quickly if players plan their drafting well.

5 Foyer

Unlocked Hallways

  • Room Effects: Hallway room doors are always unlocked
  • Cost: 2 gems

When drafting new rooms, finding that progress is blocked by a locked door when players have no keys to open it can be frustrating. The Foyer ensures that the doors in any new hallway will be unlocked by default, which can be a great advantage for drafting coherent routes.

This also applies to the Great Hall room, which is an extra-long hallway that spawns with more doors. For players who are trying to make a route to the Antechamber and "complete" a run, this can be a vital room.

6 Freezer

Frozen Assets

  • Room Effects: Freezes gold and gems, retaining them for the next run
  • Cost: No cost

The freezer can be a valuable room, but players have to use this one wisely. The Freezer "freezes" a player's coins and gems, which means they're saved for the next run, but they can't be used or added to on this run.

This is useful if players know a run is not going anywhere, and they'd rather start over with some assets intact. The effect can also be reversed in a run with a Sauna or Furnace if the player's luck changes.

7 Coat Check

Item Saver

  • Room Effects: Save an item to collect later
  • Cost: No cost

The Coat Check can be a very useful room when players are trying to deal with the longer-form puzzles in Blue Prince . This room allows players to save an item, including tools and quest items, and retrieve it the next time they visit a Coat Check. Strategic use of this room can save players a lot of steps in a run.

8 Conference Room

Item Collection

  • Room Effects: Collects items that would spread around the mansion
  • Cost: No cost

The Conference Room is a great quality of life room, if players have some other beneficial rooms placed down in their run. When a room bonus spreads items around rooms in the mansion, like the Locker Room, these items will instead be collected in the Conference Room. That turns this room into a one-stop item collection room, with two additional doors that players can draft from.

9 Library

Forbidden Knowledge

  • Room Effects: Request books, adjacent rooms have a higher chance of rarity
  • Cost: No cost

The ability to request books in the Library might not seem like much, but it can be vital to progressing with the puzzles and mysteries in Blue Prince . When requested, books appear in the library the next day and contain hidden knowledge about the mansion and its puzzles.

To help make this a convenience rather than a chore to draft each run, the Nook can be upgraded to a Reading Nook, which guarantees the Library can be drafted as an adjoining room.

10 Workshop

Crafting Options

  • Room Effects: Enables item combining/crafting
  • Cost: No cost

The Workshop can provide vital tools that help with the exploration of the mansion, acquiring extra items, and solving puzzles. Entering this room allows players to combine items to make new tools with more capabilities, like sledgehammers or shovels that find higher rarity loot. This works best when combined with a Coat Check, so that players can save their most valuable tools for when they're most needed.

11 Observatory

Stargazer

  • Room Effects: Tallies stars, gives various effects when interacting with the telescope
  • Cost: 1 gem

Every time the Observatory is drafted, the game tallies the number of stars the player collects. The more stars a player has, the more constellations they can activate when they interact with the telescope in the Observatory.

Players will have to set up the telescope when they first enter the room, but after that, interacting with the telescope will grant different effects based on the constellation activated. These are generally beneficial effects that affect room drafting, with an especially powerful bonus available if players manage to reach 50 stars.

12 Armory

Geared Up

  • Room Effects: Enables purchase of unique items
  • Cost: No cost

The Armory is a unique shop that can be somewhat tricky to add to the drafting pool. To be able to draft this room, players need to solve the chess puzzle, which is one of the game's most elaborate puzzles. Then, they need to select the Mantle of the Knight as their bonus.

Once the Armory is unlocked, players can purchase a random selection of unique items there. They all have their useful bonuses, but by far the most powerful is the Axe, which can permanently remove the gem cost of drafting a room.

item.title: The Longer NetherRealm Takes to Pull the Trigger on Injustice 3, The More Expansive One Feature Will Have to Be
item.description:
Injustice 3 has yet to be announced, but lovers of NetherRealm Studios' DC-based fighting series will certainly be rejoicing if that announcement ever comes. Players continue to hope for Injustice 3 , and while the game has not been officially confirmed, a third entry in the series now seems more likely than ever.

The current CEOs of DC Studios, James Gunn and Peter Safran, recently revealed that they have been in talks with WB-owned studio NetherRealm, and, while not definitive, that could hint at the existence of Injustice 3 . It's been a long eight years since Injustice 2 was released, and the longer NetherRealm waits to make the next entry, the more time the entry will have to spend on recapping the overall story.

As Fans Wait for Injustice 3, the Details of the First Two Chapters Are Bound to Get Murky

The Complex Lore of Injustice Can Be Difficult to Summarize

A lot happened in Injustice: Gods Among Us and Injustice 2 . Between the dismantling of Superman's One Earth Regime in the first game and the arrival of The Society and Brainiac in the second, there is a lot to know going into a hypothetical Injustice 3 .

Unless NetherRealm has been secretly working on a third Injustice game for quite some time, it may still be years before this next entry arrives. This means that Injustice 3 could release a full decade, or more, after the launch of Injustice 2. Unless a fan replays the Injustice franchise often, they may not remember the story arc in its entirety for that amount of time. While fans could simply replay both games just before the release of Injustice 3 , in order to get proper recaps, they may prefer to jump right into the new game instead of spending time rehashing old plot points.

If Gunn and Safran's DC film universe takes off, it could set the stage for Injustice 3 to be greenlit by Warner Bros.

Injustice 3 Can't Dwell On the Past Too Much

The long wait between Injustice 2 and Injustice 3 really puts the writers at NetherRealm in a difficult and interesting position. It's a given that they will want to give players a rundown of what happened in the first and second games, but how the writers go about doing that remains to be seen. There could simply be an option in the game's menu to watch a recap of the most-important events up until that point, though that could make addressing those past events within the story of Injustice 3 feel jarring.

Unless NetherRealm has been secretly working on a third Injustice game for quite some time, it may still be years before this next entry arrives.

Recapping past events is a delicate balancing act, and the long wait between entries could make things especially tricky for Injustice 3 . Injustice 3 will have to come out swinging if it wants to make up for so much lost time, and that could make it difficult to give past events the time that is needed.

NetherRealm's Next Move is a Huge Mystery

  • A recent NetherRealm job listing was searching for a senior animator to help develop a "story mode campaign."
  • This job listing has led to rumors of a new Mortal Kombat 1 expansion.

Since MK1 is NetherRealm's most recent game, and the aforementioned job listing specifies "experience with martial arts/fighting games," it only makes sense for one to assume that the developer is preparing more content for that title. However, the listing could be pointing towards Injustice 3 's development. An expansion for MK1 may be more likely, but there is still a chance that Injustice 3 is drawing closer to becoming a reality.
